hedline.hl1: FCB Combines Units And Adds Operation

abstract.p: FCB Worldwide, New York, part of True North Communications, to form new interactive customer-relationship management unit, by combining its FCB Direct and FCB Digital operations; new worldwide direct and interactive unit, to be called FCBi, will have 850 employees and offices in 27 countries and billings estimated at $775 million (Advertising column)

block.p: FCB Worldwide in New York, part of True North Communications, is forming a new interactive customer-relationship management unit, by combining its FCB Direct and FCB Digital operations. The new worldwide direct and interactive unit, to be called FCBi, will have 850 employees out of offices in 27 countries and billings estimated at $775 million from clients like AT&T, Compaq Computer and Warner Brothers. Steve Humphrey, 57, president and chief executive at FCB Direct, will continue in those posts at FCBi.

FCB Worldwide in New York, part of True North Communications, is forming a new interactive customer-relationship management unit, by combining its FCB Direct and FCB Digital operations. The new worldwide direct and interactive unit, to be called FCBi, will have 850 employees out of offices in 27 countries and billings estimated at $775 million from clients like AT&T, Compaq Computer and Warner Brothers. Steve Humphrey, 57, president and chief executive at FCB Direct, will continue in those posts at FCBi.

FCB is also opening a new database technology and management unit called Analytici. It will have 50 employees working for clients like Bristol-Myers Squibb. Steve Horne, 42, executive vice president for marketing technologies at FCB, becomes the president at Analytici.
